{"step_by_step_thinking": "Extraction of a tooth during an acute infection can indeed cause the spread of infection, but this is not typically extensive. It is unlikely to cause sudden death due to pulmonary embolism, as this condition is more associated with deep vein thrombosis. Trigeminal neuralgia is a chronic pain condition that affects the trigeminal nerve, which carries sensation from your face to your brain, and it's not directly related to tooth extraction. However, extraction can help with drainage and relieve pain, especially if proper antibiotics are given and their adequate blood level is reached.", "answer_choice": "B"}
